reviews.review:
I've only played portal 2 for 8 hours yet i can't stop playing its so fun portal 2 innovates on the original so much but still has that portal 1 feel, where should i start... The single player campaign is absolutely amazing i love Wheatley, he is personally my favorite character in the game. The humor is right up my alley it's a nice mix of wittiness and unexpectedness to make me laugh anytime of the day.
       The co-op is just a really nice touch because it works with portal quite well, I've had a lot of fun with this mode and working with my friends and strangers.
    And finally the level editor, just WOW this is amazing to finally have i love making test chambers, i do wish there was more freedom like changing textures or more items other than that i think this mode is a blast.

          9/10 i really recommend portal 2.
I wanna bang GLaDOS so goddman hard holy goddamn motherfucking shit

This game is a very good game. The puzzles will make you think quite vigourously. I really wish i had a portal gun in real life to everytime i saw a black person, SHOOT, and they are halfway across the earth. or, if i really wanted to, i could do humanity a great service and just send every black person to the moon.
it was good fun.. till my friend turned into an idiot

This game is fantastic and if you haven't played it yet what are you doing with your life!? 
Ok next part, any game devs reading this hear me out. A sequel to the portal game that takes place in the 80's, you are a homeless person that was paud 60 dollars to do a study at aperture. You start fighting the mantis men and then the whole facility starts falling apart and you get the portal gun and have to solve room puzzles to escape, while also killing more mantis men along the way, so you could have the portal gun and whatevet gun they gave you to kill mantis men. The end of the game would be us witnessing Caroline being downloaded into Glados and her coming online for the first time, squashing the mantis men and killing all extraneous personnel including us. I know lots of run on sentences, but the idea is there, i want zero compensation for this idea, someone please make this game!
it was fun and gave me a new perspective
I've never been so happy about getting insulted by a robot

it doesnt have mario so its alright

The incredible follow up for the amazing original Portal. 

Portal 2 takes place at least a few decades after the events of the original game in the abandoned Aperture Science facility.... but it won't be abandoned for long.

In Portal 2 you get to explore the long abandoned old sections of the facility that were built in the 1960's.

Portal 2 is full of drama, puzzles and comedy, you won't regret it.
pretty good game, the story on single player is epic and the coop is also epic
